failures: If the direct product of two groups is torsion free then each of the groups is torsion free.
Every set of Borel measure zero is Lebesgue measurable.
For every subset of the Euclidean plane, there is a line segment of unit length whose endpoints are either both inside the subset or both outside it.
Every set that is Lebesgue measurable but not Borel measurable has Lebesgue measure zero.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ (p : ℕ) [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p = 2 ∨ p % 2 = 1
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every prime number is `2` or odd.
There are infinitely many odd natural numbers.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: Nat.Prime 3
elaborated-prompts.prompt: The smallest odd prime is `3`.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∃ f, ∀ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime (f p) ∧ Odd (f p)
elaborated-prompts.prompt: There are infinitely many odd prime numbers.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Ringₓ R], IsField R
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every ring is a field.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: (K : Type u) → [inst : Field K] → Ring K
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every field is a ring.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: {R : Type u_1} → [inst : Ringₓ R] → Group (Units R)
elaborated-prompts.prompt: The set of units in a ring forms a group.

elaborated-prompts.theorem:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroupₓ V] [inst_2 : Module K V],
  FiniteDimensional K V
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every vector space is finite dimensional.

elaborated-prompts.theorem:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroupₓ V] [inst_2 : Module K V],
  Module.rank K V = 2 → FiniteDimensional K V
elaborated-prompts.prompt: If a vector space has dimension `2` then it is finite dimensional.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: {K : Type u} → [inst : Field K] → DivisionRing K
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every field is a division ring.

elaborated-prompts.theorem:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroupₓ V] [inst_2 : Module K V],
  Module.rank K V ≤ 2 → FiniteDimensional K V
elaborated-prompts.prompt: If a space has dimension `2` then it is finite dimensional.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Groupₓ G], Monoidₓ.IsTorsion G
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every group is a torsion monoid.
Every natural number has a successor.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ (n : ℕ), n < Nat.succ n
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every natural number is less than its successor.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Groupₓ G] [inst_1 : Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G → ∃ p, Fact (Nat.Prime p) ∧ Fintype.card G = p
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every finite simple group has prime order.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Groupₓ α] [inst_1 : Fintype α], IsSimpleGroup α
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every finite group is simple.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst : Fintype α], ∃ p, Nat.Prime p ∧ Fintype.card α = p
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every finite group has prime order.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ (x y z : ℕ), PythagoreanTriple ↑x ↑y ↑z → ∃ x' y' z', PythagoreanTriple ↑x' ↑y' ↑z' ∧ x' ≠ x ∧ y' ≠ y ∧ z' ≠ z
elaborated-prompts.prompt: There are infinitely many Pythagorean triples.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {α : Type u_1} {m : MeasurableSpace α} (s : Set α), MeasurableSet s
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every set is Lebesgue measurable.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] {s : Set α}, coeFn MeasureTheory.volume.toOuterMeasure s = 0
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every set has Lebesgue measure zero.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] {s : Set α}, (∀ (t : Set α), IsClosed t ∧ ¬s ⊂ t → IsCompact t) → IsCompact s
elaborated-prompts.prompt: If every proper closed set of a topological space is compact, then the space itself is compact.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : CompactSpace α] (s : Set α), IsCompact s
elaborated-prompts.prompt: If a topological space is compact, then every subset is compact.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p % 4 = 1 → ∃ a b, a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 = p
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every prime that is one greater than a multiple of four can be expressed as the sum of two squares.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], ¬∃ a, a * a = p
elaborated-prompts.prompt: No prime number is a perfect square.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {p : ℕ}, Nat.Prime p → p % 2 = 1 → 2 < p
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every odd prime number is greater than `2`.

elaborated-prompts.theorem:
∀ {𝕜 : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} [inst : LinearOrderedRing 𝕜] [inst_1 : AddCommGroupₓ E] [inst_2 : Module 𝕜 E]
  [inst_3 : DenselyOrdered 𝕜] [inst_4 : NoZeroSmulDivisors 𝕜 E] {C : Set E},
  Convex 𝕜 C → ∀ (x₁ x₂ : E), x₁ ∈ C → x₂ ∈ C → ∀ (x : E), x ∈ Segment 𝕜 x₁ x₂ → x ∈ C
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every line segments whose endpoints are in a convex set `C` is contained in `C`.
The product of two numbers, each of which is the sum of four squares, is itself a sum of four squares.

elaborated-prompts.theorem: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : CompactSpace α], LocallyCompactSpace α
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every compact topological space is locally compact.

elaborated-prompts.theorem:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : UniformSpace α] [inst_1 : UniformSpace β] {f : α → β},
  Continuous f → UniformContinuous f
elaborated-prompts.prompt: Every continuous function is uniformly continuous.
